sect2.title: The Library
sect2.para: The &application; library file is a database of the songs listed in your library, and the playlists that you've created. This xml file is located in the .gnome/rhythmbox directory in your home directory. It is unique for each user on your system. Do not move or delete this file, as a a new, empty library will be created when the application is next opened.

sect2.title: The Sidebar
sect2.para:
The sidebar is where you can access your music files, groups and CDs. The sidebar allows access to the following:
The &application; library, where all of the imported songs will appear.
Any groups that have been created to organize the library contents.
Audio CD's inserted into the computer's CD drives.

sect2.title: The Toolbar
sect2.para: The &application; toolbar provides easy access to functions used for playing tracks. From here it is possible to Play, Skip to a previous or next track, Pause a playing track, or select 'shuffle' play.
It also shows the volume control, which is described later.

note.para: The layout of the toolbar can be customized, see

sect2.title: Groups
sect2.para: A group is a 'playlist' of songs that has been created in &application;. It might consits of a groups of songs of a particular 'genre', a specific group of artists, or even songs that are of a particular 'mood'.

sect2.title: Panel Applet
sect2.para: The Notification Area is a Gnome feature that allows applications to add a small icon to the panel while the program is running. &application; adds it's icon to the notification area and this allows you control &application; from your tray.

note.para: For more info on using the Applet , see

sect2.title: Importing music files
sect2.para: When &application; is first started, there will be no entries in its library. Use the Organize -> Add to Library menu item to add songs to your library.

sect2.title: The Library
sect2.para: Once a songs has been imported, it can be played, dragged to a playlist so that it can be grouped with other songs, or burnt onto a CD.

sect3.title: Adding Songs
sect3.para:
A song can be added to the library in a couple of ways, as shown below;
Imported in the same manner as detailed in the section.
Drag and drop
Individual selection

sect3.title: Playing Songs/Albums
sect3.para: To play a track, either select the track and press the 'Play' button on the toolbar, or simply double-click on the track (or Album or Artist) to start playing.

The 'player' area provides access to details about the currently playing track. When a track is not being played, this area shows no information. When 'Play' is selected, the track name is displayed, and underneath, the artist and the album names. A tracker is also displays, showing the progress of the playing.
The arrow keys can be used to Fast-Forward or Rewind the playing track

tip.para: Clicking on the artist or album name (where they are underlined) will load the appropriate 'allmusic.com' page.

sect3.title: Volume Control
sect3.para: The volume of playback can be adjusted using the volume slider in the top right hand of the view. Sliding the to the right will increase the volume, whilst to the left will reduce it. The loudspeaker icon will change to indicate the relative volume.

note.para: To mute the sound, click on the loudspeaker icon, and to restore the muted sound, do likewise.

sect3.title: Using the Browser
sect3.para: This allows the library to be easily browsed, showing the artist, then albumn of the current track. It is not shown when viewing a group or audio CD.

When started, the browser defaults to viewing all artists, and all tracks. Selecting an individual artist will change the Album list to show all albums by this artist, and the track list changes to show all tracks for these albums. Selecting an album will change the track list to show only the contents of this album.

sect3.title: Searching
sect3.para: To search the &application; library for a particular word or phrase, type into the search field, and the view will show all the entries that have the search criteria will be shown the in the tracks list.

sect2.title: Groups
sect2.para: As previously explained, a group is a 'playlist' of entries in the library.
To display a group, simply click on the required group, and the library display will change to show the contents.

sect3.title: Adding Songs
sect3.para: To create a group use one of the following methods:

itemizedlist.listitem: Drag a 'track', 'album' or 'artist' to the sidebar. When the group is created, it will default to either the name of the artist (when dropping an artist), the name of the album (when an album), or when a track is dropped, a dialog is displayed, prompting for the name of the group (which is by default named 'Untitled').

Open the Organize menu and coose the New Group item (CtrlN will do the same thing). Again a dialog is displayed prompting for a name, and if the 'Add selected track' option box is ticked, then any selected tracks will be added to the group.

sect3.title: Modifying a Group
sect3.para: Right click on a group to display the group menu. This will allow the renaming and deletion of the group. Selecting the Rename will display a prompt for the new name of the group (pressing F2 when a group is selected will do the same). Selecting the Delete will delete the group (note that the 'content' of the group is not removed from the library, just the 'playlist'.

sect3.title: Playing
sect3.para: When a CD is inserted to the CD drive, it will appear in the sidebar, and the songs on it can be displayed in &application;'s main window.
To play and pause playback, or to skip forward or backwards, use the same controls as used for playing from the library.

sect3.title: Listening via Internet
sect3.para: The Internet Radio tuner can be used to listen to streamed audio files.

sect2.title: Panel Applet
sect2.para: Using the &application; notification area in the systray, the following commands can be sent to the application:

itemizedlist.listitem: Previous — Skip to previous song in playlist.
Next — Skip to next song in playlist.
Show Window — toggle whether the &application; window is visible.

sect2.title: Preferences
sect2.para: Using the preferences dialog you can customise how you want Rhythmbox to look.

sect2.title: Toolbar editting
sect2.para: The Toolbar editor lets you add, remove and re-order buttons on the Rhythmbox toolbar.
